page.title: 04An interview with Mr. Scales
page.content:
**{Mr Scales the church warden}**
If you are a{church warden,}you are in charge of the church and everything in the church. So that if the church warden wanted to take the seats out he could do it if two wardens agreed.
He was in the{choir}for 4 years from the age of 7 - you had a choice of being in the choir but in those days the choir was very full.
He got no pocket money and started working when he was 14, earning 4 shillings (20 pence) a week.
His father was a stone mason in{Egton {Estate.}He has worked for the church for 60 years. He didn't have a best pal at school because you were friendly with everyone. By M.Templeton
